cards.title: Bunnies & Rabbits - external
cards.summary: Bunny refers to the small, bun-shaped tail of the rabbit. A rabbit is a type of mammal. They are small, furry animals with large ears and powerful back legs.

cards.title: Foxes- internal
cards.summary: Foxes are small to medium-sized, omnivorous mammals belonging to several genera of the family Canidae. They have upright triangular ears and a long bushy tail.

cards.title: LLamas- external
cards.summary: Llamas are social animals and live with others as a herd. Llamas can learn simple tasks after a few repetitions.

cards.title: Puppies- internal
cards.summary: A puppy is a juvenile dog.

cards.title: Tigers- external
cards.summary: The tiger is the largest living cat species and a member of the genus Panthera. It is most recognisable for its dark vertical stripes on orange fur.

cards.title: Whales- internal
cards.summary: Whales breathe air, are warm-blooded, give live birth, the young suckles on milk and have hair. They are the largest animal on Earth up to 100 ft long and live in every ocean.
